column1: Cary L. Cooper obtained his B.S. and M.B.A. degrees in behavioural science from the University of California, Los Angeles and his Ph.D. from the University of Leeds. He is currently senior lecturer in psychology at the University of Manchester. Institute of Science and Technology. He has written two books, T-Groups: A Survey of Research, (John Wiley & Sons, 1971) and Group Training for Individual and Organizational Development (S. Karger AG, Basel, Switzerland, 1973) and has another book, Theories of Group Processes (John Wiley A. Sons), in preparation for publication in late 1974. He is an Executive Member of the Group Relations Training Association and the European Editor of the international quarterly journal, Interpersonal Development
